Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Add public API analyzer to track changes" (#1337) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Closed pull request "Remove custom project load style" (#1315) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
This had been in place for some performance issues in VS. It does make
development challenging, and with the refactoring of the framework from
the strongly typed classes, Visual Studio seems to handle this better.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Convert LINQ generator to run as source generator" (#1345) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody: This change integrates the LINQ generator with the source generator infrastructure so things will stay up-to-date as well as use a single source of truth.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Comments for LINQ generated code does not contain inherited attributes/elements" (#1356) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Previously, the generation for the code relied on runtime information which would automatically get the inherited value. With the move to using source generators, this is not the case and is not straightforward with the current data structure.

The direction to investigate here would be:

- Create a lookup in OpenXmlGeneratorServices that would search the types given `SchemaType.BaseClass`
- Update the backend to not use a class name in `SchemaType.BaseClass` but rather a QName

_Originally posted by @twsouthwick in https://github.com/dotnet/Open-XML-SDK/issues/1345#issuecomment-1459157916_
